security_audit.summary: This is a pure markdown documentation skill containing zero executable code. All 38 static findings are false positives caused by pattern matching on benign educational text content. The skill provides methodology for writing creative briefs - no file access, network calls, or command execution exists.

content.user_title: Generate Professional Educational Visuals with Creative Briefs
content.value_statement: Generic AI visuals often produce bland, PowerPoint-default aesthetics. This skill provides professional creative brief methodology that activates AI reasoning for distinctive, pedagogically effective educational visuals.
actual_capabilities: Creates strategic visual plans before generation
Writes narrative-driven creative briefs instead of technical specifications
Aligns visual complexity with student proficiency levels (A2, B1, C2)
Validates prerequisites to prevent teaching concept violations
Applies token conservation strategies for batch visual generation
Prevents duplicate visual patterns across chapter content
limitations: Does not generate images directly. Requires separate image generation tool
Cannot read or access files. Provides methodology only
Assumes user has access to chapter documentation for context
Optimized for Gemini but works with any text-based AI model

use_cases.title: Create Teaching Visuals
use_cases.description: Generate pedagogically aligned visuals for educational content with proper complexity gates based on student proficiency levels.

use_cases.title: Visual Story Planning
use_cases.description: Plan distinctive visual narratives using creative briefs that activate AI reasoning instead of generic outputs.

use_cases.title: Proficiency-Aligned Graphics
use_cases.description: Create visuals matched to student skill levels from beginner to advanced with appropriate complexity limits.

prompt_templates.title: Strategic Visual Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the chapter documentation. Identify proficiency level and prerequisites. Create a strategic plan for visual assets. Wait for approval before proceeding.

prompt_templates.title: Creative Brief Writing
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a creative brief with: The Story, Emotional Intent, Visual Metaphor, Key Insight, Color Semantics with hex codes, and Pedagogical Reasoning.

prompt_templates.title: Proficiency Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Review proposed visual complexity against proficiency level. For A2 beginners: max 5-7 elements and under 5 second grasp time. Flag any violations.

prompt_templates.title: Duplicate Prevention Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check existing visual patterns in the chapter. List all image files and corresponding prompts. Ensure new visual uses distinct type and metaphor from existing ones.

output_examples.input: Create a visual explaining compound interest growth for intermediate students
output: Story: A single seed multiplying into a vast orchard over time
Emotional Intent: Surprising magnitude of small choices compounded
Visual Metaphor: Multiplication cascade like compound interest
Key Insight: Small starting amounts grow dramatically over time
Color Semantics: Green for growth, blue for stability
Proficiency Gate: B1 allows 7-10 elements with simple interaction

output_examples.input: Plan visual assets for a beginner chapter on AI fundamentals
output: Strategic Plan: 4 visuals total for this A2 chapter
Complexity Limits: Max 5 elements per visual, static only
Prerequisite Check: No programming concepts, basic terminology only
Visual Types: 1 timeline, 1 comparison diagram, 2 concept illustrations
Distinctiveness: Each uses different visual metaphor and structure

best_practices: Always read chapter documentation before creating visuals to understand context and prerequisites
Use narrative intent and metaphors instead of pixel specifications to activate AI reasoning
Validate proficiency-complexity alignment early to prevent wasted work on inappropriate visuals
anti_patterns: Using pixel specifications like coordinates and font sizes instead of creative briefs
Skipping the strategic planning phase and jumping directly into visual generation
Assuming knowledge that students do not have based on course prerequisites

faq.question: Which AI models work with this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Gemini, Claude, Claude Code, Codex, and any model that responds to text prompts for image generation.

faq.question: What are the proficiency levels?
faq.answer: Three levels: A2 beginner (max 7 elements), B1 intermediate (max 10 elements), C2 professional (no limits).

faq.question: Does this skill generate images directly?
faq.answer: No. This skill creates creative briefs and plans. Use with an image generator skill for actual image creation.

faq.question: Is any data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. This is a pure methodology skill with no file access, network calls, or data storage.

faq.question: Why use creative briefs instead of technical specs?
faq.answer: Technical specs activate prediction mode for generic output. Creative briefs activate reasoning for distinctive visuals.

faq.question: Can I use this with other visual generation skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Use this skill for planning and prompt design, then pass the creative briefs to image generator skills.
